By default CodeceptJS uses WebDriverIO helper and Selenium to automate browser. Within web page you can locate elements, interact with them, and check that expected elements are present on a page. However, you can also choose Nightmare or Protractor helpers, driven by corresponding libraries. No matter of helper and library you use for acceptance testing, CodeceptJS should execute same actions in similar manner.
trans-unit.target: Por defecto, CodeceptJS usa WebDriverIO helper y Selenium para automatizar el navegador. Dentro de la página web puede ubicar elementos, interactuar con ellos y verificar que los elementos esperados estén presentes en una página. Sin embargo, también puede elegir los ayudantes Nightmare o Protractor , manejados por las bibliotecas correspondientes. No importa el asistente y la biblioteca que use para las pruebas de aceptación, CodeceptJS debe ejecutar las mismas acciones de manera similar.

trans-unit.source: CodeceptJS allows to test mobile and hybrid apps in a similar manner web applications are tested. Such tests are executed using Appium (opens new window) on emulated or physical devices. Also, Appium allows to test web application on mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: CodeceptJS allows to use several browser windows inside a test. Sometimes we are testing the functionality of websites that we cannot control, such as a closed-source managed package, and there are popups that either remain open for configuring data on the screen, or close as a result of clicking a window. We can use these functions in order to gain more control over which page is being tested with Codecept at any given time. For example:

trans-unit.source: CodeceptJS bypasses execution commands to helpers. Depending on helper enabled your tests will be executed differently. If you need cross-browser support you should choose Selenium-based WebDriverIO or Protractor, if you are interested in speed - use Chrome-based Puppeteer, or Electron-based Nightmare. Those engines can run tests in window mode or headlessly and doesn't require additional tools to be installed.

trans-unit.source: CodeceptJS is a modern end to end testing framework with a special BDD-style syntax. The test is written as a linear scenario of user's action on a site.
trans-unit.target: El CodeceptJS es un marco de pruebas moderno de extremo a extremo con una sintaxis especial de estilo BDD.La prueba está escrita como un escenario lineal de la acción del usuario en un sitio.

trans-unit.source: CodeceptJS is a modern end to end testing framework with a special BDD-style syntax. The tests are written as a linear scenario of the user's action on a site.
CodeceptJS is a rich testing frameworks which also provides features missing in original TestCafe:

CodeceptJS is an acceptance testing framework. In diversified world of JavaScript testing libraries it aims to create a unified high level API for end-to-end testing, powered by different backends. CodeceptJS allows you to write a test and switch in config execution drivers: will it be wedriverio, puppeteer, or protractor depends on you. This way you aren't be bound to implementation, and your acceptance tests will work no matter of framework running them.
trans-unit.target: CodeceptJS es un marco de prueba de aceptación. En el mundo diversificado de las bibliotecas de pruebas de JavaScript, su objetivo es crear una API unificada de alto nivel para pruebas de extremo a extremo, impulsada por diferentes backends. CodeceptJS le permite escribir una prueba y cambiar los controladores de ejecución de configuración: ¿será wedriverio , titiritero o transportador depende de usted? De esta manera, no estará obligado a la implementación, y sus pruebas de aceptación funcionarán sin importar el marco que las ejecute.

trans-unit.source: CodeceptJS is an acceptance testing framework. In the diversified world of JavaScript testing libraries, it aims to create a unified high-level API for end-to-end testing, powered by a variety of backends. CodeceptJS allows you to write a test and switch the execution driver via config: whether it's wedriverio, puppeteer, or protractor depends on you. This way you aren't bound to a specific implementation, and your acceptance tests will work no matter what framework is running them.
CodeceptJS packed into container with the Nightmare, Protractor, Puppeteer, and WebDriverIO drivers.
trans-unit.target: CodeceptJS empaquetado en un contenedor con los conductores de Nightmare,Protractor,Puppeteer y WebDriverIO.

trans-unit.source: CodeceptJS provides API to run custom code before and after the test and inject custom listeners into the event system.
trans-unit.target: CodeceptJS proporciona una API para ejecutar código personalizado antes y después de la prueba e inyectar escuchas personalizadas en el sistema de eventos.

trans-unit.source: CodeceptJS provides a debug mode in which additional information is printed. It can be turned on with --debug flag.
trans-unit.target: CodeceptJS proporciona un modo de depuración en el que se imprime información adicional. Se puede activar con la bandera --debug .

trans-unit.source: CodeceptJS provides a flexible syntax to specify an element to click.
trans-unit.target: El CodeceptJS proporciona una sintaxis flexible para especificar un elemento para hacer clic.

trans-unit.source: CodeceptJS provides a fluent builder to compose custom locators in JavaScript. Use locate function to start.
trans-unit.target: CodeceptJS proporciona un generador fluido para componer localizadores personalizados en JavaScript. Use la función de locate para comenzar.

trans-unit.source: CodeceptJS provides a module with event dispatcher and set of predefined events.
trans-unit.target: CodeceptJS proporciona un módulo con despachador de eventos y un conjunto de eventos predefinidos .

trans-unit.source: CodeceptJS provides high-level API on top of WebDriver protocol. While most standard implementations focus on dealing with WebElements on page, CodeceptJS is about user scenarios and interactions. That's why you don't have a direct access to web elements inside a test, but it is proved that in majority of cases you don't need it. Tests written from user's perspective are simpler to write, understand, log and debug.
CodeceptJS runner is available inside container as codeceptjs.

trans-unit.source: Compared to the API proposed by CodeceptJS, the Protractor code looks more complicated. Even more important, it's harder to read and follow the logic of the Protractor test. Readability is a crucial part of acceptance testing. Tests should be easy to modify when there are changes in the specification or design. If the test is written in Protractor, it would likely require someone familiar with Protractor to make the change, whereas CodeceptJS allows anyone to understand and modify the test. CodeceptJS provides scenario-driven approach, so a test is just a step-by-step representation of real user actions. This means you can easily read and understand the steps in a test scenario, and edit the steps when the test needs to be changed.
Comparing to Appium, Detox runs faster and more stable but requires an additional setup for build.

Comparing to the API proposed by CodeceptJS, this code looks a bit more complicated. But what the more important, it's really really hard to read and follow its logic. Readability is the most crucial part in acceptance testing. You should easily change tests when changes specification or design. Probably, only a person who writes Protractor tests in your company, could do those changes, while CodeceptJS allows anyone to work with tests. Contrary, CodeceptJS provides CodeceptJS provides scenario-driven approach, so test is just a step-by-step representation of real user actions. This way you can easily read, and follow test scenario, and edit it when you need it to be changed.

trans-unit.source: Helper is the core concept of CodeceptJS. Helper is a wrapper on top of various libraries providing unified interface around them. When I object is used in tests it delegates execution of its functions to currently enabled helper classes.

trans-unit.source: Helpers are ES6 classes inherited from corresponding abstract class. Generated Helper will be added to codecept.json config. It should look like this:

trans-unit.source: Helpers are classes inherited from corresponding abstract class (opens new window). Created helper file should look like this:
Helpers can also be installed as Node packages and required by corresponding Node modules
trans-unit.target: Los ayudantes también pueden ser instalados como paquetes de Nodos y requeridos por los correspondientes módulos de Nodos

trans-unit.source: Helpers can be created by running a generator command:
trans-unit.target: Los ayudantes pueden crearse ejecutando un comando generador:

trans-unit.source: Helpers can be reconfigured per scenario or per feature. This might be useful when some tests should be executed with different settings than others. In order to reconfigure tests use .config() method of Scenario or Feature.
trans-unit.target: Los ayudantes se pueden reconfigurar por escenario o por característica. Esto puede ser útil cuando algunas pruebas deben ejecutarse con configuraciones diferentes que otras. Para reconfigurar las pruebas, utilice el método .config() de Scenario o Feature .

trans-unit.source: Helpers is a core concept of CodeceptJS. Helper is a wrapper around various libraries providing unified interface around them. Methods of Helper class will be available in tests in I object. This abstracts test scenarios from the implementation and allows easy switching between backends. Functionality of CodeceptJS should be extended by writing a custom helpers.
trans-unit.target: Helpers es un concepto central de CodeceptJS. Helper es un contenedor de varias bibliotecas que proporciona una interfaz unificada a su alrededor. Los métodos de la clase Helper estarán disponibles en pruebas en el objeto I .Esto resume los escenarios de prueba de la implementación y permite cambiar fácilmente entre backends. La funcionalidad de CodeceptJS debe ampliarse escribiendo ayudantes personalizados.

trans-unit.source: Helpers may contain several hooks you can use to handle events of a test. Implement corresponding methods to them.
trans-unit.target: Los ayudantes pueden contener varios ganchos que se pueden usar para manejar los eventos de una prueba.Implementar los métodos correspondientes a ellos.

trans-unit.source: Helpers should be enabled inside codecept.json or codecept.conf.js files. Command generate helper does that for you, however you can enable them manually by placing helper to helpers section inside config file. You can also pass additional config options to your helper from a config - (please note, this example contains comments, while JSON format doesn't support them):
trans-unit.target: Los ayudantes deben estar habilitados dentro de los archivos codecept.json o codecept.conf.js . El comando generate helper lo hace por usted, sin embargo, puede habilitarlos manualmente colocando la sección helper to helpers dentro del archivo de configuración. También puede pasar opciones de configuración adicionales a su ayudante desde una configuración (tenga en cuenta que este ejemplo contiene comentarios, mientras que el formato JSON no los admite) :

trans-unit.source: How does your client, manager, or tester, or any other non-technical person, know your web application is working? By opening the browser, accessing a site, clicking on links, filling in the forms, and actually seeing the content on a web page.
trans-unit.target: ¿Cómo sabe su cliente,gerente o probador,o cualquier otra persona no técnica,que su aplicación web está funcionando? Abriendo el navegador,accediendo a un sitio,haciendo clic en los enlaces,rellenando los formularios,y viendo realmente el contenido de una página web.

trans-unit.source: It is common to think that BDD scenario is equal to test. But it's actually not. Not every test should be described as a feature. Not every test is written to test real business value. For instance, regression tests or negative scenario tests are not bringing any value to business. Business analysts don't care about scenario reproducing bug #13, or what error message is displayed when user tries to enter wrong password on login screen. Writing all the tests inside a feature files creates informational overflow.
trans-unit.target: Es común pensar que el escenario de BDD es igual a la prueba.Pero en realidad no lo es.No todas las pruebas deben ser descritas como una característica.No todos los tests están escritos para probar el valor real de los negocios.Por ejemplo,las pruebas de regresión o las pruebas de escenarios negativos no aportan ningún valor a los negocios.A los analistas de negocios no les importa que el escenario reproduzca el error 13,o qué mensaje de error se muestra cuando el usuario trata de introducir una contraseña incorrecta en la pantalla de inicio de sesión.Escribir todas las pruebas dentro de un archivo de características crea un desbordamiento de información.

It is important to make sure it is compatible with current webdriverio version.

It is important to understand that Nightmare executes JavaScript on client and on server side. If you need to find an element you should search for it using client side script, but if you want to do an assertion you should return a data to server side.
trans-unit.target: Es importante entender que Nightmare ejecuta JavaScript en el lado del cliente y del servidor.Si necesitas encontrar un elemento debes buscarlo usando el script del lado del cliente,pero si quieres hacer una afirmación debes devolver un dato al lado del servidor.

trans-unit.source: It is modern Electron based testing framework which allows to execute tests in headless mode as well as in window mode for debug purposes. This makes Nightmare very useful, much more handy than PhantomJS. Nightmare is in active development and has nice API for writing acceptance tests. Unfortunately, as all other JavaScript testing frameworks it has its own very custom API. What if you choose it for a project and suddenly you realize that you need something more powerful, like Selenium? Yes, that might be a problem if you are not using CodeceptJS. The one idea behind CodeceptJS is to unify different testing backends under one API, so you could easily write tests the same way no matter what engines you use: webdriverio, Protractor, or Nightmare.
trans-unit.target: Es un moderno marco de pruebas basado en electrones que permite ejecutar pruebas en modo sin cabeza así como en modo de ventana para propósitos de depuración.Esto hace que Nightmare sea muy útil,mucho más útil que PhantomJS.Nightmare está en desarrollo activo y tiene un buen API para escribir pruebas de aceptación.Desafortunadamente,como todos los demás frameworks de pruebas de JavaScript tiene su propia API muy personalizada.¿Qué pasa si lo eliges para un proyecto y de repente te das cuenta de que necesitas algo más potente,como el Selenio? Sí,eso podría ser un problema si no estás usando CodeceptJS.La única idea que hay detrás de CodeceptJS es unificar diferentes backends de pruebas bajo una API,de modo que puedas escribir fácilmente pruebas de la misma manera sin importar los motores que utilices:webdriverio,Protractor o Nightmare.

trans-unit.source: It is possible to execute global conditional retries to handle unforseen errors. Lost connections and network issues are good candidates to be retried whenever they appear.
trans-unit.target: Es posible ejecutar reintentos condicionales globales para manejar errores imprevistos.Las conexiones perdidas y los problemas de red son buenos candidatos para ser reintentados cuando aparezcan.

trans-unit.source: It is possible to wait for elements pragmatically. If a test uses element which is not on a page yet, CodeceptJS will wait for few extra seconds before failing. This feature is based on Implicit Wait (opens new window) of Selenium. CodeceptJS enables implicit wait only when searching for a specific element and disables in all other cases. Thus, the performance of a test is not affected.

It is possible to wait for elements pragmatically. If a test uses element which is not on a page yet, CodeceptJS will wait for few extra seconds before failing. This feature is based on Implicit Wait of Selenium. CodeceptJS enables implicit wait only when searching for a specific element and disables in all other cases. Thus, the performance of a test is not affected.
trans-unit.target: Es posible esperar elementos pragmáticamente. Si una prueba usa un elemento que aún no está en una página, CodeceptJS esperará unos segundos adicionales antes de fallar. Esta característica se basa en la espera implícita de selenio. CodeceptJS habilita la espera implícita solo cuando se busca un elemento específico y se deshabilita en todos los demás casos. Por lo tanto, el rendimiento de una prueba no se ve afectado.

Like you may have noticed, CodeceptJS doesn't use by.* locators similar to Protractor or Selenium Webdriver. Instead most of methods expect you to pass valid CSS or XPath. In case you don't want CodeceptJS to guess the type of locator, you can specify them using so-called strict locators. This is an absolute analogy of by, so you can use angular specific locators (like models, repeaters, bindings, etc) in it:
trans-unit.target: Como habrás notado, CodeceptJS no utiliza los localizadores by.* Similares a Protractor o Selenium Webdriver. En cambio, la mayoría de los métodos esperan que pase CSS o XPath válidos. En caso de que no desee que CodeceptJS adivine el tipo de localizador, puede especificarlos utilizando los llamados localizadores estrictos. Esta es una analogía absoluta de by , por lo que puede usar localizadores angulares específicos (como modelos, repetidores, enlaces, etc.) en él:

trans-unit.source: Nightmare
trans-unit.target: Nightmare

trans-unit.source: Nightmare helper is supposed to work in the same manner as WebDriverIO or Protractor. This means that all CodeceptJS actions like click, fillField, selectOption and others are supposed to work in the very same manner. They are expressive and flexible to accept CSS, XPath, names, values, or strict locators. Follow the helper reference for detailed description.
trans-unit.target: Se supone que Nightmare helper funciona de la misma manera que WebDriverIO o Protractor. Esto significa que todas las acciones de CodeceptJS como click , fillField , selectOption y otras deben funcionar de la misma manera. Son expresivos y flexibles para aceptar CSS, XPath, nombres, valores o localizadores estrictos. Siga la referencia de ayuda para obtener una descripción detallada.

trans-unit.source: Nightmare helper wraps Nightmare (opens new window) library to provide fastest headless testing using Electron engine. Unlike Selenium-based drivers this uses Chromium-based browser with Electron with lots of client side scripts, thus should be less stable and less trusted.

Nightmare helper wraps Nightmare library to provide fastest headless testing using Electron engine. Unlike Selenium-based drivers this uses Chromium-based browser with Electron with lots of client side scripts, thus should be less stable and less trusted.
trans-unit.target: Nightmare helper envuelve la biblioteca Nightmare para proporcionar pruebas sin cabeza más rápidas utilizando el motor Electron. A diferencia de los controladores basados ​​en Selenium, este utiliza un navegador basado en Chromium con Electron con muchos scripts del lado del cliente, por lo tanto, debería ser menos estable y menos confiable.

trans-unit.source: Nightmare instance can be accessed by custom helper:
trans-unit.target: La instancia de pesadilla puede ser accedida por un ayudante personalizado:

trans-unit.source: Nightmare provides evaluate method to execute client-side JavaScript. CodeceptJS registers codeceptjs object globally on client side with findElement and findElements methods in it. They return IDs of matched elements so you can access them in next calls to evaluate:
trans-unit.target: Nightmare proporciona un método de evaluate para ejecutar JavaScript del lado del cliente. CodeceptJS registra el objeto codeceptjs globalmente en el lado del cliente con los métodos findElement y findElements . Devuelven ID de elementos coincidentes para que pueda acceder a ellos en las próximas llamadas para evaluate :

trans-unit.source: Nightmare provides you with more control to browser engine than Selenium does. This allows you to use headers in your tests. For instance, CodeceptJS provides haveHeader method to set default headers for all your HTTP requests:
trans-unit.target: Nightmare le proporciona más control al motor del navegador que Selenium. Esto le permite usar encabezados en sus pruebas. Por ejemplo, CodeceptJS proporciona el método haveHeader para establecer encabezados predeterminados para todas sus solicitudes HTTP:

trans-unit.source: NightmareJS support only CSS locators for web elements, while CodeceptJS improves it to use XPath as well. This is how form can be located by labels, and buttons by text in examples above. It is done by injecting client-side scrips (for element location) to every loaded page. Also all events like click, doubleClick, keyPress are simulated by JavaScript, this makes testing less relevant, as they are not native to operating systems.
trans-unit.target: NightmareJS solo admite localizadores CSS para elementos web, mientras que CodeceptJS lo mejora para usar XPath también. Así es como se pueden ubicar los formularios por etiquetas y botones por texto en los ejemplos anteriores. Se realiza inyectando scripts del lado del cliente (para la ubicación del elemento) en cada página cargada. Además, todos los eventos como click, doubleClick, keyPress son simulados por JavaScript, esto hace que las pruebas sean menos relevantes, ya que no son nativas de los sistemas operativos.

trans-unit.source: NodeJS >= 8.9

NodeJS Workers can communicate between each other via messaging system. It may happen that you want to pass some data from one of workers to other. For instance, you may want to share user credentials accross all tests. Data will be appended to a container.

Note: Chunking will be most effective if you have many individual test files that contain only a small amount of scenarios. Otherwise the combined execution time of many scenarios or big scenarios in one single test file potentially lead to an uneven execution time.
trans-unit.target: Nota:La fragmentación será más efectiva si tienes muchos archivos de prueba individuales que contengan sólo una pequeña cantidad de escenarios.De lo contrario,el tiempo de ejecución combinado de muchos escenarios o grandes escenarios en un solo archivo de prueba puede llevar a un tiempo de ejecución desigual.

trans-unit.source: Option waitForAction defines how long to wait after a click, doubleClick or pressKey action is performed. Test execution may happen much faster than the response is rendered, so make sure you set a proper delay value. By default CodeceptJS waits for 500ms.
trans-unit.target: La opción waitForAction define cuánto tiempo esperar después de que se realiza una acción click, doubleClick o pressKey. La ejecución de la prueba puede ocurrir mucho más rápido que la respuesta, así que asegúrese de establecer un valor de retraso adecuado. Por defecto, CodeceptJS espera 500 ms.

trans-unit.source: Page Fragments represent autonomous parts of a page, like modal boxes, components, widgets. Technically they are the same as PageObject but conceptually they are a bit different. For instance, it is recommended that Page Fragment to include a root locator of a component. Methods of page fragment can use within block to narrow scope to a root locator:
trans-unit.target: Los fragmentos de página representan partes autónomas de una página, como cuadros modales, componentes, widgets. Técnicamente son lo mismo que PageObject, pero conceptualmente son un poco diferentes. Por ejemplo, se recomienda que el Fragmento de página incluya un localizador raíz de un componente. Los métodos de fragmento de página pueden usarse within bloque para limitar el alcance a un localizador raíz:

trans-unit.source: Perform a click on a link or a button, given by a locator. If a fuzzy locator is given, the page will be searched for a button, link, or image matching the locator string. For buttons, the "value" attribute, "name" attribute, and inner text are searched. For links, the link text is searched. For images, the "alt" attribute and inner text of any parent links are searched.
trans-unit.target: Realiza un clic en un enlace o un botón,dado por un localizador.Si se da un localizador borroso,se buscará en la página un botón,enlace o imagen que coincida con la cadena del localizador.En el caso de los botones,se buscan el atributo "valor",el atributo "nombre" y el texto interno.Para los enlaces,se busca el texto del enlace.Para las imágenes,se busca el atributo "alt" y el texto interno de cualquier enlace superior.

Playwright
trans-unit.target: Playwright

trans-unit.source: Playwright Example

Playwright can be added to GitHub Actions using official action (opens new window). Use it before starting CodeceptJS tests to install all dependencies. It is important to run tests in headless mode (otherwise you will need to enable xvfb to emulate desktop (opens new window)).

Playwright can emulate browsers of mobile devices. Instead of paying for expensive devices for mobile tests you can adjust Playwright settings so it could emulate mobile browsers on iPhone, Samsung Galaxy, etc.
Playwright commands are asynchronous so a callback function must be async.
Playwright contains a list of predefined devices (opens new window) to emulate, for instance this is how you can enable iPhone 6 emulation for all tests:

Playwright is a Node library to automate the Chromium (opens new window), WebKit (opens new window) and Firefox (opens new window) browsers with a single API. It enables cross-browser web automation that is ever-green, capable, reliable and fast.
Playwright uses different strategies to detect if a page is loaded. In configuration use waitForNavigation option for that:
Playwright was built similarly to Puppeteer (opens new window), using its API and so is very different in usage. However, Playwright has cross browser support with better design for test automaiton.
Please look at the respective Factory sections for examples for factory modules and configuration.

Please note that some config changes can't be applied on the fly. For instance, if you set restart: false in your config and then changing value browser won't take an effect as browser is already started and won't be closed untill all tests finish.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que algunos cambios de configuración no se pueden aplicar sobre la marcha. Por ejemplo, si configura restart: false en su configuración y luego cambiar el valor del browser no tendrá efecto ya que el navegador ya se inició y no se cerrará hasta que finalicen todas las pruebas.

trans-unit.source: Please note, I object can't be used helper class. As I object delegates its calls to helper classes, you can't make a circular dependency on it. Instead of calling I inside a helper, you can get access to other helpers by using helpers property of a helper. This allows you to access any other enabled helper by its name.
Please note, this service can be used with Protractor helper as well!

Please note, you can't run tests by different helpers at once. You can't use some APIs from WebDriverIO and some from Nightmare. You should pick one helper, as it definses how tests are executed. If requirements change it's easy to migrate to another, but don't use few helpers at once. It's just not possible.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que no puede ejecutar pruebas de diferentes ayudantes a la vez. No puede usar algunas API de WebDriverIO y algunas de Nightmare. Debe elegir un ayudante, ya que define cómo se ejecutan las pruebas. Si los requisitos cambian, es fácil migrar a otro, pero no use pocos ayudantes a la vez. Simplemente no es posible.

trans-unit.source: Please notice that instead of I you should use this in current context.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que en lugar de I debería usar this en el contexto actual.
